meanings.definition: To cut off the top or outer parts of (something)
meanings.sent1: She cropped the photo to remove the background.
meanings.sent2: The farmer cropped the wheat before the harvest.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally cropped the cake too much, making it look funny.
meanings.sent4: His excitement cropped up when he saw the cropped image of his favorite celebrity.
meanings.sent5: The barber cropped the hair neatly, giving the customer a fresh look.

meanings.definition: To cut short or trim (hair, plants, etc.)
meanings.sent1: I need to crop my hair before the summer.
meanings.sent2: The gardener cropped the bushes to keep them tidy.
meanings.sent3: She playfully cropped her friend's hair while they were sleeping.
meanings.sent4: The tailor cropped the fabric with precision, creating a perfect fit.
meanings.sent5: The sheepdog cropped the grass in the field, maintaining a neat appearance.

meanings.definition: To appear in a photograph or picture as a head and shoulders image
meanings.sent1: She cropped the group photo to focus on her face.
meanings.sent2: The model's headshot was cropped for the magazine cover.
meanings.sent3: The ghost cropped up in the family portrait, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her smile cropped up in the framed picture, bringing back fond memories.
meanings.sent5: The artist cropped the painting to highlight the subject's expression.
